title: Arithmetic
text: dbMatrix objects support Arith Ops operations. demonstrate perform arithmetic operations dbSparseMatrix objects. Note: operations zero values yet supported dbMatrix objects. addition, certain arithmetic operations dbMatrix objects also yet supported. welcome user feedback reporting issues Github page.

title: Arithmetic
text: test file dgCMatrixor compressed sparse column matrix representing single cell gene expression matrix. file data directory package. Let’s load .rds file preview object. file contains 634 rows 624 columns. rows represent gene names columns represent cell names. values integers represent number times gene detected cell. Like single-cell RNA-seq data, matrix sparse.
code: dgc <- readRDS("../data/dgc.rds")  dplyr::glimpse(dgc) #> Formal class 'dgCMatrix' [package "Matrix"] with 6 slots #>   ..@ i       : int [1:170625] 0 6 10 17 21 22 25 31 33 35 ... #>   ..@ p       : int [1:625] 0 227 510 758 980 1293 1631 1976 2223 2434 ... #>   ..@ Dim     : int [1:2] 634 624 #>   ..@ Dimnames:List of 2 #>   .. ..$ : chr [1:634] "Gna12" "Ccnd2" "Btbd17" "Sox9" ... #>   .. ..$ : chr [1:624] "AAAGGGATGTAGCAAG-1" "AAATGGCATGTCTTGT-1" "AAATGGTCAATGTGCC-1" "AAATTAACGGGTAGCT-1" ... #>   ..@ x       : num [1:170625] 1 1 1 1 1 1 6 2 1 1 ... #>   ..@ factors : list()

title: Arithmetic
text: Let’s create dbSparseMatrix object dgc object.
code: # Note: by default the constructor creates a dbMatrix object in-memory con <- DBI::dbConnect(duckdb::duckdb(), ":memory:")  dbsm <- dbMatrix(value = dgc,                   con = con,                   name = 'visium',                   class = "dbSparseMatrix",                  overwrite = TRUE)  # preview the object dbsm #> 634 x 624  dbMatrix of class "dbSparseMatrix" #> [[ Colnames 'AAAGGGATGTAGCAAG-1', 'AAATGGCATGTCTTGT-1', 'AAATGGTCAATGTGCC-1' ... suppressing 618 ...'TTGTCGTTCAGTTACC-1', 'TTGTGGCCCTGACAGT-1', 'TTGTTCAGTGTGCTAC-1' ]] #>                                                                           #> Gna12         1.0000000 2.0000000 1.0000000 1.0000000 9.0000000 1.0000000 #> Ccnd2                 . 1.0000000 1.0000000         .         . 1.0000000 #> Btbd17                . 1.0000000 1.0000000 1.0000000         .         . #>  #> ......suppressing 614 columns and 628 rows #>  #> Gm19935               . 1.0000000         .         .         .         . #> 9630013A20Rik         .         .         .         .         .         . #> 2900040C04Rik 1.0000000         .         .         .         .         .

title: Arithmetic
text: dbMatrix emulates scalar arithmetic Matrix package. Note: Addition subtraction non-zero addends dbSparseMatrix results dbDenseMatrix.

title: Arithmetic
text: dbMatrix also supports matrix arithmetic dbMatrix objects conformable.
code: dbsm + dbsm #> 634 x 624  dbMatrix of class "dbSparseMatrix" #> [[ Colnames 'AAAGGGATGTAGCAAG-1', 'AAATGGCATGTCTTGT-1', 'AAATGGTCAATGTGCC-1' ... suppressing 618 ...'TTGTCGTTCAGTTACC-1', 'TTGTGGCCCTGACAGT-1', 'TTGTTCAGTGTGCTAC-1' ]] #>                                                                                 #> Gna12          2.0000000  4.0000000  2.0000000  2.0000000 18.0000000  2.0000000 #> Ccnd2                  .  2.0000000  2.0000000          .          .  2.0000000 #> Btbd17                 .  2.0000000  2.0000000  2.0000000          .          . #>  #> ......suppressing 614 columns and 628 rows #>  #> Gm19935                .  2.0000000          .          .          .          . #> 9630013A20Rik          .          .          .          .          .          . #> 2900040C04Rik  2.0000000          .          .          .          .          .

title: Arithmetic
code: dbsm * dbsm #> 634 x 624  dbMatrix of class "dbSparseMatrix" #> [[ Colnames 'AAAGGGATGTAGCAAG-1', 'AAATGGCATGTCTTGT-1', 'AAATGGTCAATGTGCC-1' ... suppressing 618 ...'TTGTCGTTCAGTTACC-1', 'TTGTGGCCCTGACAGT-1', 'TTGTTCAGTGTGCTAC-1' ]] #>                                                                                 #> Gna12          1.0000000  4.0000000  1.0000000  1.0000000 81.0000000  1.0000000 #> Ccnd2                  .  1.0000000  1.0000000          .          .  1.0000000 #> Btbd17                 .  1.0000000  1.0000000  1.0000000          .          . #>  #> ......suppressing 614 columns and 628 rows #>  #> Gm19935                .  1.0000000          .          .          .          . #> 9630013A20Rik          .          .          .          .          .          . #> 2900040C04Rik  1.0000000          .          .          .          .          .

text: test file dgCMatrixor compressed sparse column matrix representing single cell gene expression matrix. file data directory package. Let’s load .rds file preview object.
code: dgc <- readRDS("../data/dgc.rds")  dplyr::glimpse(dgc) ## Formal class 'dgCMatrix' [package "Matrix"] with 6 slots ##   ..@ i       : int [1:170625] 0 6 10 17 21 22 25 31 33 35 ... ##   ..@ p       : int [1:625] 0 227 510 758 980 1293 1631 1976 2223 2434 ... ##   ..@ Dim     : int [1:2] 634 624 ##   ..@ Dimnames:List of 2 ##   .. ..$ : chr [1:634] "Gna12" "Ccnd2" "Btbd17" "Sox9" ... ##   .. ..$ : chr [1:624] "AAAGGGATGTAGCAAG-1" "AAATGGCATGTCTTGT-1" "AAATGGTCAATGTGCC-1" "AAATTAACGGGTAGCT-1" ... ##   ..@ x       : num [1:170625] 1 1 1 1 1 1 6 2 1 1 ... ##   ..@ factors : list() # create dbSparseMatrix from the same dgc con <- DBI::dbConnect(duckdb::duckdb(), ":memory:")  sparse <- dbMatrix(value = dgc,                     con = con,                     name = 'visium',                     class = "dbSparseMatrix",                    overwrite = TRUE)  # preview  # show function aims to emulate the show method for dgCMatrix head(sparse) ## 6 x 624  dbMatrix of class "dbSparseMatrix" ## [[ Colnames 'AAAGGGATGTAGCAAG-1', 'AAATGGCATGTCTTGT-1', 'AAATGGTCAATGTGCC-1' ... suppressing 618 ...'TTGTCGTTCAGTTACC-1', 'TTGTGGCCCTGACAGT-1', 'TTGTTCAGTGTGCTAC-1' ]] ##                                                                                ## Gna12    1.0000000 2.0000000 1.0000000 1.0000000 9.0000000 1.0000000 3.0000000 ##                                        ## Gna12    5.0000000 3.0000000         . ##  [ reached 'max' / getOption("max.print") -- omitted 5 rows ]

title: Overview
text: dbMatrix core package dbverse library inherits dbData base class consists two subclasses, dbSparseMatrix dbDenseMatrix. dbMatrix objects emulate -memory dense sparse matrices embedded database powered DuckDB.

title: Overview
text: Sparse matrices represented triplet vectors , j, x numerical vectors. j refer row column indices, respectively, specific x values counts. Note: j vectors one-based following conventions Matrix R package TSparseMatrix class. dbSparseMatrix class stores triplet vector representation associated dimension names dimensions available. none provided, automatically generated factors (enums) row# col# labels rownames colnames, respectively. dbSparseMatrix class contain zeros triplet vector representation. Zero values inferred based provided dimensions. Support compressed sparse column matrices dgCMatrix class Matrix R package currently implemented. information sparse matrices, see wiki article .

title: Overview
text: use approach dbSparseMatrix represent dense matrix triplet , j, x vector. difference dbDenseMatrix class consists values matrix, including zeros.

title: dbMatrix 0.0.0.9123 (2025-10-07)
text: dbProject Integration: Full integration dbProject package dbData base class architecture. dbMatrix now inherits dbData providing unified database-backed object interface across dbverse ecosystem. Statistical Methods: Added rowSds(), colSds(), rowVars(), colVars() methods dbDenseMatrix dbSparseMatrix. dbVector Support: Internal support dbVector arithmetic operations.

title: dbMatrix 0.0.0.9123 (2025-10-07)
text: Migrated repository dbverse-org organization previous location. Updated URLs links reflect new dbverse-org organization structure. Required DuckDB >= 1.4.0 (LTS) improved stability. Updated documentation markdown formatting improvements. Added cli imports better user messaging.

title: dbMatrix 0.0.0.9123 (2025-10-07)
text: Added S4 class documentation pkgdown reference index (dbMatrix-class, dbDenseMatrix-class, dbSparseMatrix-class). Updated vignettes include memory names parameters summary functions. Improved roxygen documentation compute(), .matrix(), arithmetic operations. Enhanced documentation dbProject integration dbData inheritance.

title: dbMatrix 0.0.0.9123 (2025-10-07)
text: Eliminated ORDER Warnings: Fixed ORDER warnings removing arrange() lazy evaluation paths summary methods. Now applies ordering materializing results memory. Fixed sim_dgc() function use correct number random values (rnorm(n_vals) instead rnorm(num_cols)), eliminating “number items replace” warnings. Removed deprecated context() call test files (testthat 3rd edition). Fixed to_view() calls pass tbl objects instead dbMatrix objects dbProject functions. Imported dbProject generics properly avoid namespace conflicts. Added init slot dbMatrix class definition. Removed redundant export t() method. Fixed names() method return NULL regular matrices instead throwing errors. Corrected name attribute assignment Ops() method dbMatrix. Improved connection handling internal get_con() function. Removed dbReconnect() method generics (moved dbProject/dbData). Refactored extract methods - functionality now comes dbProject::dbData base class. Exported dbMatrix class properly NAMESPACE. Fixed DESCRIPTION dependencies: removed duplicate dbProject Suggests, added proper Remotes reference.

title: dbMatrix 0.0.0.9023 (2024-09-18)
text: dbMatrix summary methods now return dbDenseMatrix objects instead -memory vectors. Removed colTypes castNumeric. Removed @name check initialize.

title: dbMatrix 0.0.0.9023 (2024-09-18)
text: New compute method saving dbMatrix objects. writes dbMatrix object table database along row column names (e.g. ‘dbMatrixname_rownames’). New load method loading computed dbMatrix objects. dbMatrix::compute() method must called loading object. Updated .check_overwrite allow passing overwrite arg. New internal function write_dimnames enable saving dbMatrix objects. New sum method dbMatrix objects. Improvements precomputed table: Use existing precomputed table db available. Improvements precomputed table: Transpose precomputed table sufficient dimensions exists instead creating new one. done via TEMPORARY VIEW avoid writing disk modifying existing precomputed table may referenced tables. Custom SQL statement todbDense conversion creates TEMPORARY VIEW name dbDenseMatrix_hash.
